alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 29 at 8:40AM MDT until October 30 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to 4 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...From noon today to 6 AM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain and snow will develop today with the snow level near 8,000 feet. The snow level will drop to valley bottoms quickly this evening. Most of the snow accumulation will occur during the afternoon and evening hours with decreasing coverage and intensity of snowfall after midnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
